channel.title: Trying to add a wildy zone at a new place - I get this error when I compile

item.title: Trying to add a wildy zone at a new place - I get this error when I compile
item.dc:creator: @Nael Nael
item.description:
@Nael wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:25, topic:537476”][quote author=Nael link=topic=656296.msg4392529#msg4392529 date=1388038281]

http://pastebin.com/UYpAAw1Z

I believe that one should work.

Thanks but oh wow, when I remove the private pvphandler… I get the 100 errors I put it where you told me to, and I’ve got the 100 errors too
There’s probably a missing { or }
[/quote]
Post your cmd.[/quote]

Not really, 100 errors is the max the compiler can display for you, which means that there are a lot of errors more than 100. It is usually caused by a missing { or } But anyways here are the first couple of lines of my compiler prompt:

symbol: variable bankItems location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:98: error: cannot find symbol c.bankItems[toBankSlot] = c.playerItems[fromSlot]; ^ symbol: variable playerItems location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:99: error: cannot find symbol if (c.playerItemsN[fromSlot]<amount){ ^ symbol: variable playerItemsN location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:100: error: cannot find symbol amount = c.playerItemsN[fromSlot]; ^ symbol: variable playerItemsN location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:102: error: cannot find symbol if ((c.bankItemsN[toBankSlot] + amount) <= Config.MAXITEM_AMOUNT && (c.b ankItemsN[toBankSlot] + amount) > -1) { ^ symbol: variable bankItemsN location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:102: error: cannot find symbol if ((c.bankItemsN[toBankSlot] + amount) <= Config.MAXITEM_AMOUNT && (c.b ankItemsN[toBankSlot] + amount) > -1) { ^ symbol: variable bankItemsN location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:103: error: cannot find symbol c.bankItemsN[toBankSlot] += amount; ^ symbol: variable bankItemsN location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:108: error: cannot find symbol c.getItems().deleteItem((c.playerItems[fromSlot]-1), fromSlot, amount); ^ symbol: variable playerItems location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:114: error: cannot find symbol if ((c.bankItemsN[toBankSlot] + amount) <= Config.MAXITEM_AMOUNT && (c.b ankItemsN[toBankSlot] + amount) > -1) { ^ symbol: variable bankItemsN location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:114: error: cannot find symbol if ((c.bankItemsN[toBankSlot] + amount) <= Config.MAXITEM_AMOUNT && (c.b ankItemsN[toBankSlot] + amount) > -1) { ^ symbol: variable bankItemsN location: variable c of type Client source\server\model\items\Banking.java:115: error: cannot find symbol c.bankItemsN[toBankSlot] += amount;

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to add a wildy zone at a new place - I get this error when I compile
item.dc:creator: @Nael Nael
item.description:
@Nael wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:21, topic:537476”]Bro you can’t put

on top of

You need to put it under that is the only way it will work. If there is any errors post them and we’ll help you.[/quote]

I did that earlier on as you’ve asked And I’ve got the 100 errors (max of what the compiler can present) meaning that there’s a great possibility of having a missing { or }. If you can please tell me EXACTLY where to put “private PvPHandler pvpHandler = new PvPHandler(this);”, then that’d be really appreciated and helpful.

Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to add a wildy zone at a new place - I get this error when I compile
item.dc:creator: @Nael Nael
item.description:
@Nael wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:537476”]You’re missing a brace.
Brace = { or }[/quote]

When I put this } after “private PvPHandler pvpHandler = new PvPHandler(this);” I got the same errors.
But when I added a { before “private PvPHandler pvpHandler = new PvPHandler(this);” and finished it with } I got an error saying this:

source\server\model\players\Client.java:57: error: illegal start of expression private PvPHandler pvpHandler = new PvPHandler(this); ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Nael Nael
item.description:
@Nael wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:13, topic:537476”][quote author=Nael link=topic=656296.msg4392061#msg4392061 date=1387868707]

private PvPHandler pvpHandler = new PvPHandler(this);

Move that down like 10 lines.

[code]private PvPHandler pvpHandler = new PvPHandler(this);

public class Client extends Player {
public Dungeoneering getDungeoneering() {
return dungeoneering;
}
private Dungeoneering dungeoneering = new Dungeoneering(this);

public byte buffer[] = null;

public int cannonTimer = 0;
public int floweritem = 0;
public int seedtimer = 0;
public int s;
public Stream inStream = null, outStream = null;
private IoSession session;
public static PlayerSave save;
public static Client cliento2;
public int totalstored;
public int currentDamage = 0;
public int followPlayer;
public boolean callFamilliar;
.
.
.
[/code]

Done
[/quote]

Move this:

Below this:

Thanks, but when I do that, I get a load of more errors?

item.title: Trying to add a wildy zone at a new place - I get this error when I compile
item.dc:creator: @Nael Nael
item.description:
@Nael wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:9, topic:537476”][quote author=Nael link=topic=656296.msg4391839#msg4391839 date=1387813937]

Why are you packaging your player class twice?

Did you mean this?
package server.model.players.pvp;
package server.model.players;

2:
Create a new package server.models.players.pvp; and in it add:

That’s what the tutorial said?

So you never have two packages in a class thats like saying the class is in 2 locations at once.

What the tutorial told you to do is to make a NEW package server.model.players.pvp.

Once you actually make the NEW package take out

package server.model.players;

Okay thanks a lot, and sorry about that, but I still have this error:

source\server\model\players\Client.java:52: error: class, interface, or enum expected private PvPHandler pvpHandler = new PvPHandler(this); ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Did you import the correct directory?

I think so :
[/quote]

post the top of your client class with all your imports.[/quote]

Here…

[code]package server.model.players;
import server.model.players.pvp.PvPHandler;
import server.model.players.Player;
import java.util.LinkedList;
import java.util.Queue;
import java.util.concurrent.Future;
import java.net.URL;
import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import server.Connection;
import server.model.players.packets.ClickItem;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import server.model.players.;
import server.model.players.skills.Dungeoneering;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import server.model.players.Content.;
import server.model.players.skills.Prayer;
import java.io.IOException;
import server.model.minigames.;
import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession;
import server.Config;
import server.Server;
import java.net.URL;
import server.model.npcs.;
import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import server.model.items.Banking;
import java.io.IOException;
import server.model.players.BankPin;
import server.model.items.ItemAssistant;
import server.model.shops.ShopAssistant;
import server.net.HostList;
import server.net.Packet;
import server.net.StaticPacketBuilder;
import server.util.Misc;
import server.model.players.skills.Summoning;
import server.util.Stream;
import server.model.players.Content.RequestHelp;
import server.model.players.skills.*;
import server.model.players.skills.FlaxStringer;
import server.model.players.PlayerSave;
import server.model.players.PlayerHandler;
import server.model.minigames.WarriorsGuild;
import server.model.minigames.PestControl;
import server.model.minigames.Gambling;
import server.model.minigames.Nomad;
import server.model.minigames.Elvarg;
import server.model.players.QuickCurses;
import server.model.players.QuickPrayer;
import server.task.Task;

private PvPHandler pvpHandler = new PvPHandler(this);

public class Client extends Player {
public Dungeoneering getDungeoneering() {
return dungeoneering;
.
.
.[/code]

Hope this helps

item.source: Trying to add a wildy zone at a new place - I get this error when I compile

item.title: Trying to add a wildy zone at a new place - I get this error when I compile
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“Nael, post:7, topic:537476”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=656296.msg4391824#msg4391824 date=1387808072]

Why are you packaging your player class twice?

Did you mean this?
package server.model.players.pvp;
package server.model.players;

2:
Create a new package server.models.players.pvp; and in it add:

That’s what the tutorial said?

So you never have two packages in a class thats like saying the class is in 2 locations at once.

What the tutorial told you to do is to make a NEW package server.model.players.pvp.

Once you actually make the NEW package take out

package server.model.players;

Okay thanks a lot, and sorry about that, but I still have this error:

source\server\model\players\Client.java:52: error: class, interface, or enum expected private PvPHandler pvpHandler = new PvPHandler(this); ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Did you import the correct directory?
[/quote]

I think so :[/quote]

post the top of your client class with all your imports.

Read full topic
